fields.physical_description: Album of pencil and pen and ink drawings by George P. Markeson.  An inscription on the inside of the front cover dates this album ca. 1935.  The album consists of 120 pages with 145 pencil and pen and ink drawings on paper pasted on to the pages.  One of the drawings is drawn on cardboard.  In addition, there are 9 pencil and pen and ink drawings, 3 envelopes with pencil sketches loosely inserted into the album.  Also, a print by Hynes taken from 'The Bystander, February 10, 1932 p. 359 is pasted into the album.  The album is cloth bound with a design blocked on the upper cover consisting of children sitting under a tree.
fields.dimensions: Height: 30 cm album, Width: 25 cm album
fields.materials_techniques: Pen and ink and pencil on paper
fields.marks:
'Sketches by G P Markeson c1935'
 '6.5.62 Ch/L'
 [p. 7]  'By- SIR, WHEN I WAS IN THE PUNJABIS, BY-SIR!!  Two aspects of the font-walk'

[p. 11]  'I'm the Lady that works for the woman what …' [Illegible inscription].

[p. 12] 'MEMO TEA WITH THE BLANKS 4.30 pm'

[p. 14] 'Jenny the Cook'

[p. 15] 'La joie de vivre'

[p. 15] 'Aunt Matilda paddles'

[p. 15] 'MACKESON' [spelt out with lines between each letter and underlined too]

[p. 21] 'MEMOIRS OF A MIDGET P.E.N.M.'

[p. 30] "The curate has called."

[p. 31] "L'oeil du maitre"

[p. 33] 'Chinese Soil'

[p. 37] '… STABBED HIM TO THE HEART BY - I DID SIR, AND SERVE HIM- WELL RIGHT SIR!!!   The fruty major dines at the Club.'  [Ill. One]

[p. 37] 'Fishing Cats' [Ill. two]

[p. 37] 'No Joel at Kennack! I have to do my best in the sands with umbrellas & a tennis ball!! D-n!!!! (Drawn from life).'

[p. 39] 'TRIUMPH'

[p. 40] 'MRS P. MACK IE'

[p. 50] 'LEDGER DAY BOOK'

[p. 51] 'DOCTOR OWL'

[p. 58] 'PASTE Labour saving.' [Ill. One]

[p. 58] 'WHAT DAY IS IT? WHAT WEEK IS IT? WHAT MONTH IS IT? WHAT YEAR IS IT? WHAT CENTURY IS IT?' [Ill. Two]

[p. 58] 'DEC 25th of Found large pot of honey [jar labelled] FINEST HONEY A Bear's journal'

[p. 60] 'The Bystander, February 10, 1932 259 "The Captain wants a glass of water, quick!" BY HYNES.'  Ill. Signed Hynes.

[p. 62] 'For old nazan blades'

[p. 63] 'For inscribing WISDOM'

[p. 64] 'GOD BLESS OUR HOME'

[p. 65] 'F. ROGG OIL & COLOUR DECORATOR'

[p.70] 'NO ADMITTANCE TO FOXES, STOATS AND OTHER VERMIN  CARROT VIEW NOTICE This Hutch is entirely my own construction. Peter Rab. FRIBA'

[p. 71] 'R. OBBIN TAILOR AND BREECHES WARE' [In mirror handwriting]

[p. 78] 'The New Boy' [Ill. 1]

[p. 78] 'Gnomes marching' [Ill. 2]

[p. 79] 'RULES FOR TADPOLES RULES FOR USE OF THE POND' [Ill. 1]

[p. 79] 'Bursting Gnome'

[p. 80] 'Leap-Frog' [Ill. 1]

[p. 80] 'Hobgoblins' Hey' [Ill. 2]

[p. 81] 'a frome mariner' [Ill. 1]

[p. 81] 'The Snow-man' [Ill. 2]

[p. 81] 'The evil-doer'

[p. 82] 'The Headmaster' [Ill. 1]

[p. 82] Ill. signed 'G. P. Markeson' [Ill. 2]

[p. 83-84] Envelope franked 'London W.5 25.V.43 p.m.' 2nd class stamp.  Typed on front of envelope: 'George P. Markeson, Esq., Queen Cottage, Bledlow, Aylesbury, Bucks.'  Calculations in pencil and ink. 

[p. 85-86] 'SPRING'

[p. 87-88] Envelope franked 'WEST BROMPTON 9.30 am 21 NOV 1939 S.W.10 .'  Envelope inscribed in ink to 'Mrs. Peyton Markeson, Flat A. 1 Eldon Rd. Kensington, London.  W.8.'

[p. 105-106]  Envelope inscribed in ink '1, Eldon Road, W.8.'

[p. 119-120] 'Swearword the Saxon'

[Back pastedown]  -"and so to bed." (Pepys).
